name: 楊元森
objective: The use of probability models and statistical methods for analyzing data has become common practice in virtually all scientific disciplines. This course attempts to provide a brief introduction to those models and methods likely to be encountered and used by students in their careers in engineering and sciences.
schedule:
Week  1:     Overview and Descriptive Statistics
  Introduction, nothing is 100%, 2% in 50 years
  Excel skill: SUM, AVERAGE, COUNTIF
  Assignment: Hand plotting a histogram (on a blank A4 paper) 
Weeks 2-4:   Probability
  Week 2 off
  Week 3: Measure of Location and Variability (sample/population mean/standard deviation), Excel demonstration on summation of random numbers 
  Week 4: Assignment 01: Probability of tossing die for 10 times and get average < 3.0. 
Weeks 5-8:   Discrete Random Variables and Probability Distributions
  Week 5: Set Theory, probability of union, intersection, tree diagram
  Week 6: Counting techniques
  Week 7: Conditional probability, independence
Week 9:      Midterm
Weeks 10-12:   Continuous Random Variables and Probability Distributions
Weeks 13-15: Joint Probability Distributions and Random Samples
Weeks 16-17: Point Estimation
Week  18:    Final
scorePolicy:
Activity in class: 30% (+/-5% with 95% of confidence)
Midterm: 30% (+/-5% with 95% of confidence)
Final: 40% (+/-5% with 95% of confidence)

Probability and Statistics for Engineering and the Sciences (7th Ed.)
